file_content.text: There's a hatch that leads into the caves beneath Coronet City. The First Son went there, to our last sanctuary.
We do not have the manpower for another assault.
But our forces are decimated.
Is there any chance the First Son could have left?
You're sure he's still there?
There's no other way out of the caves. He's there, I swear.
Our men could hold Guardian Hold One while you go after him.
But it'll be tight. His men will have us pinned. Jedi, you have to stop him quickly.
We can hold Guardian Hold One, no more.
Any reinforcements will overrun us. Stop him now.
This confrontation has been too long delayed.
In that case, I'm following.
Jedi, wait. There's not enough men to assault those caves--we can barely hold Guardian Hold One.
The troops can buy time, but if the Empire sends reinforcements, they're in for a rough ride.
Get everyone back to this point, brace the doors, and stay put.
Barricade yourselves in.
Defend Guardian Hold One as circumstances demand. I know you'll do what's necessary.
I trust the defense to you.
I wish I was there in person. I'll do my best from here.
Assess the wounded, put the most able in the first rank and don't give an inch.
Be aggressive.
If you're absolutely sure.
Guardian Hold One must be held. Too many are wounded.
You stop First Son. We defend your back.
Brace the doors and fall back to this position. Don't fight unless you have to, understand?
Barricade yourselves in.
Let your intuition guide you.
I trust your visions.
I understand.
Put anyone who can hold a blaster near the entrance and tell them to hold their positions.
Be aggressive.
As you say.
Our men will give you as long as possible, but we may have to withdraw. If... if you succeed, meet us back at the ship.
We're ready when you are, Jedi.
Whatever happens, knowing all of you has been a privilege.
It's been an honor.
I know Nadia would say the same. Let's go.
Enough time has been lost already.
We should go.
Scorekeeper smiles. Is great work we do. Come.
This won't be easy. Stay focused, I can't afford any distractions.
Don't get in my way.
Keep your head, we'll keep ours. Come on, work to do.
Blades have fallen, blood has staunched. It is twilight and silence here, for now.
The seeing one and his guardians blazed brightly, Sky Hunter. They felled a hundred Imperial warriors, before their silence.
The seeing one and his guardians blazed brightly, Ember Fist. They felled a hundred Imperial warriors, before their silence.
The seeing one and his guardians blazed brightly, Silent Teeth. They felled a hundred Imperial warriors, before their silence.
I hope Gaden-Ko found the answer he sought.
I will miss him.
I took Gaden-Ko away from his world, his people, and sent him to his death.
He shouldn't have left Voss.
We cannot know every turn of a path, only how to walk it.
Gaden-Ko knew his duty and never hesitated. We can all learn from him.
I expected nothing less.
Councilor Saiak was one of the Children? What if I am too? What if I'm about to become some Sith puppet?
Once I stop the First Son shielding his brothers and sisters, all the Children will be revealed.
Helping me can save you.
Your selfishness is truly remarkable.
You only care about yourself?
No, please! You've got to protect me!
Your suffering would be short-lived, I assure you.
Then I'd have to kill you.
You're our only hope. Take this--you can stop the First Son, and everything will be fine.
The First Son. You can stop him, and then it'll all be fine, right? I'll be safe?
I assure you, Jedi, this foul business deserves our full attention. Let's get it over with.
